API Reference¶

Environment¶

The Environment class is the central class of the program, because all other functionalities are called and synchronized via this class. When creating an environment instance, the corresponding data that is to be represented by this instance must be passed directly. This process data passed during initialization is stored in an internal format and automatically provided to the corresponding method when various functions are called.

class environment.Environment(data_file: str, function_file: str)¶

An execution Environment for the event based production simulation. The entire process to be mapped is defined in the transferred files and the structure must comply with certain rules.

Parameters

  • data_file (str) – Path to the json-file with the process data

  • function_file (str) – Path to the py-file with the function definitions

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – No matching files could be found for the given file paths

  • MissingParameter – The attribute ‘item’ or ‘station’ was not defined in the process file or an item or station object has no defined name

  • UndefinedFunction – One of the referenced functions could not be found in the function file

  • UndefinedObject – One of the referenced item or station could not be found in the data file

  • InvalidType – The component list has an element which is not of type list or the capacity of an item or station isn’t of type int

  • InvalidValue – The capacity of a item or station isn’T greater than zero

  • NotSupportedParameter – One of the values of user defined attributes has an undefined identifier

inspect_data() → None¶

Checks the given data for possible errors that do not lead to an exception when generating the internal data formats, but would lead to a crash during the simulation. The corresponding errors are systematically output. This function should not be called at the same time as the simulation, since the errors are not corrected by this method, but only indicated and thus the simulation crashes nevertheless. Thus this method is to be seen as a help to free new data sets before the simulation from errors.

visualize() → None¶

This method is used to visualize the input process data by creating an interactive network graph of the input process data. It shows both the material flow and the item and station specific parameters. This method initiates a local development app on a flask server on localhoast:8050. For an example see example 01.
